text: I have had 5 sinus surgeries in total. I have had sinus infections constantly and my medical Dr was treating me with antibiotics and shots. He finally told me that I needed to find a specialist to go to. At first I chose another Dr who removed a fungus from my nose and I thought that would do the trick. I will not name this Dr, but he had a terrible bedside manner. He wouldn't take any time with me to discuss anything. So after two months after surgery I started having trouble again. I went to my computer and typed in, The Best ENT Doctors In Birmingham. Right away I found Dr. Sillers name and when I clicked on it, I knew that this Dr was for me. I made the appointment and he not only took a lot of time explaining what was wrong, but also had a screen that showed me the problem. Unfortunately I had to have surgery again, but it cleared up the problem. On my last visit which was a couple of times after surgery, I ask him when I should come back and he said, "you will know when". It has been almost a year and I have had no problems. Not one sinus infection!! I could not recommend this Dr enough. I have gone to going to the my local Dr who treated me every couple of months with a sinus infection to a Dr that took care of the problem and I haven't been back to a Dr with any issue with my sinuses since my surgery. So if you are fed up like I was, come to this Dr. and I think that you will leave satisfied like I did.

name: Frank Barnett
text: Three years ago when I finally got to Dr. Mark Brown's office, I had lost vision in my right eye and was losing color vision fast in the left eye. My thyroid had been killed and I was taking thyroid replacement medicine but my eyes continued to bug out. The pressure was causing headaches which I did not know I should mention. My endocrinologist did not know you could have Graves Disease without double vision (which I didn't get until later). He sent me somewhere for dry eye and that doctor hurried me to Dr. Brown. Brown called in Dr. Ron Swain Jr, who uses 3-D mapping to guide him as he opens a pathway for Dr. Brown's work. They did decompression surgery on both eyes; Brown recommended 12 weeks of I.V. steroids, a therapy that was showing promise at the Mayo Clinic. Three years and several surgeries and procedures later I am reading at 20/20 in both eyes and seeing in full color. So far, so good! Sherry Barnett

name: Sibyl Fondren
text:
I'd been plagued with monthly sinus infections with intense pressure and pain for over a year.  During that time I saw 3 different ENTs without any long term change.  I had tried the prescribed sinus irrigation, Flonase, countless rounds of antibiotics etc. to the point I was living on decongestants to get any relief.
Dr. Benoit was the first to suggest taking a CT scan. He listened to my history and seemed to genuinely want to help me find relief. He showed me the CT scan and explained how my deviated septum and enlarged turbinates were swelling and causing not only pain but blockage which wasn't allowing mucus out or helpful medications in! He suggested a septoplasty with turbinate reduction.
My surgery was November 16, 2016 and I have had continually improving symptoms.  I have yet to have a sinus infection, I can breathe freely through both nostrils (something I never realized I couldn't do!), clearing my sinuses is a breeze now and my Flonase can actually get where it needs to go!

A huge thanks to Dr. Benoit and his friendly, efficient staff! I couldn't imagine an easier experience or a better outcome!

text:
Dr. Handley is a great ENT Doctor. I have been his patient for over 25 years. In April 1995 Dr. Handley performed my successful sinus surgery which was a great relief and overall it significantly reduced the number, duration and severity of subsequent sinus problems such as infections. Cutting down on need for medication going forward. He also diagnosed and treated me for Meniere’a Disease.
Dr. Handley has always been available when I have needed his expertise. He is the consummate medical professional. My office visits with Dr. Handley have always been useful. Dr. Handley communicates well and listens very actively and doesn’t waste any time but at the same time he is always willing to explain issues thoroughly, concisely and in a way for patients to understand. I highly recommend Dr. Handley to anyone needing critical and/or chronic ear, nose (sinus) and throat problems. He explains all treatment options including the Pros and cons of each method of treatment. Due to Dr. Handley’s success I do not see him as routinely as I first did when my sinus issues were severe and recurring; however when I do go back he knows me and my medical history.

name: Tom Atkins
text:
A few people told me to go to Costco for your hearing aids...so I did.  The technician seemed to do a thorough audio test, had a nice sound proof booth that was her office actually.  Told me of a couple of units that would work for me so I tried the cheapest one thinking they are all the same basically sound amplifiers with the ability to amplify the frequencies you have trouble hearing in. Anyway took those home wore them daily but it was not pleasant to wear. I called it an edgy sound that was not natural to me. So I went back trying to tweak them to make them more bearable. They kept falling out of my ears. Didn’t fit properly, and I still missed a lot of words. So I quit wearing them regularly. Finally went back to Costco and asked my technician are these the right ones for me. Did I buy too cheap a pair?  Should I buy a more expensive ones, etc. never really got a clear answer. Always seemed to be these are typical and should help me.

So after a couple of years suffering with the hearing aids from Costco, I finally went to McCool & Bhuta and met Rachel Lynch. Rachel is a very well trained audiologists. Right away I could tell I had found a true professional that was very knowledgeable concerning hear aids and audio testing. Rachel fit me properly the first time with the right length of in ear speakers that no longer fell out of my ears.  When I first put them on they were not edgy and the sound was very natural. I almost didn’t think they were turned on until she demonstrated how much better I could hear by walking out of site down the hall outside her office.

Now these were more expensive than the Costco but why I ever considered cost to be such an important factor for something that was so critically important, I feel foolish about that.   The ones I have now are rechargeable, can connect to my phone through a Bluetooth connection, and have a nice phone app to change a lot of the setting myself. Thanks Rachel!

They easily accomodate appointment times in a reasonable time frame. Dr Bhuta has taken care of our daughter and we have been very happy please with tubes and adenoid removal. Dr.  McCool was able to take blood from our baby with hardly a fuss (those veins are so tiny and he nailed it, first try, quick and relatively painless). This is a big feat considering he usually loses it with shots! Both doctors are caring, knowledgable and very good at what they do! I highly recommend this practice!

name: Cameron Blake
text:
I personally would not recommend going here, unless you were referred for a particular condition.

I went in, without a referral, as I have been having really disorienting issues with higher pitched sounds. I was given a told I'd be getting an Ear Drum Pressure Test, as well as a test to check my hearing.

I reluctantly agreed, believing that these tests were going to be beneficial to helping my problem. I agree that the pressure test was a good idea, but after taking the hearing test, I realize I was big scammed. I not once said I had any issues with low range noises, and this hearing test did not AT ALL consist of anything that might prove beneficial for my case. It was entirely low range based, nothing to do with why I went in. I never once said I had any issues hearing anything, beyond high frequencies causing my discomfort.

After the tests, I went back to meet with the Dr. again just to be told "Sorry, we do not have anything to test high frequencies."  Well, I would have appreciated knowing that before I agreed to these tests. The final ruling was that I may be experiencing age related hearing loss, but I am only 23 y/o.

I received a bill for $55 for a hearing test which I did not need, which also provided zero benefit for me. At least the $23 ear pressure test made sense.
Overall, $120 wasted for absolutely nothing.

name: Abby Burke
text: Do not recommend. I was referred here by my general practitioner for dizziness, fluid in my ears, ear pain, ear pressure, itching, etc. I saw a nurse practitioner which was my choosing. The wait to see the actual doctor was a lot longer. It was like they were herding cattle in this place. Very busy with little to no niceties. The NP briefly asked my symptoms, did a check with some machine to see if I had fluid on my ears and that was it. She referred me out to their physical therapy office in Madison for EAR issues and dizziness. No thanks. Never looked at my sinuses or likewise. I still have the exact same symptoms that I've had for months and this office did nothing to help nor did they take the time to actually listen and evaluate me. I will find another ENT in this area.

text: Dr.K is wonderful! Our 2 year old had to have surgery, and he took the time to fully explain everything going on. Very patient and kind. Appointments always ran on time.

name: Re Run
text: Terrible experience. It was stressed before the appointment to arrive early to complete documentation for the visit. For my 9:40 appointment I arrived around 8:50 and completed all the paperwork in 10 to 15 minutes where I was told I would soon be called back. I'm guessing that meant at some point that day. I set for hour and a half waiting to be seen as people who arrived after me were called back, and were leaving as I still waited. After finally being called back, I recieved a dry greeting from the nurse who walked me back to the room where the remaining staff just glared, clearly looking but choosing not to greet. My nurse then walks me into the wrong exam room where another patient was already sitting. We will just call that a clerical error. I finally make it to the exam room where the doctor shortly follows and begins the examination where he begins to ask my symptoms. Not that he actually cared, seeing that he didnt let me finish a sentence. I never finished giving him the details before he told me that I had nothing to worry about and gave me the same recommendation I'd received previously with no examination. The two month wait for an appointment was summed up in a five minute appointment and a two hour wait. What was my first visit will certainly be my last. I'd rather make the drive to any other location than to ever receive service from here again.

Scheduling was prompt and they kept me personally included in the process; More than once I received personal calls directly from the actual doctor with prompt updates.   I believe their thorough and logical approach very well may have saved my life.

I would highly recommend their services. Whatever you do... never ignore a persistent lump on your neck!

name: Jacob Parker
text: I have been visiting Dr. McFadden over the last several years. The staff has always been very helpful and kind. Dr. Mcfadden also performed my deviated septum surgery with no complications whatsoever. I can’t recommend this place enough.

name: Flora Adams
text: Dr. Hobbs did my tonsillectomy and I can't recommend him and his staff highly enough. They were able to schedule me very quickly for the surgery (I had to get it done over spring break my final semester of college before getting married and moving out of the country... They scheduled me just 1.5 weeks out from the surgery due to the situation), were polite and friendly and prompt throughout the entire process, answered all my questions fully and respectfully, and gave me a clear and accurate understanding of what the recovery would be like as an adult getting a tonsillectomy. Dr. Hobb's nurse and the Surgery Center both called and checked up on me multiple times after the surgery, and the surgery itself went exactly as planned. I was able to see Dr. Hobbs in less than 24 hours when I called with concerns about healing on one side of my thoat 3 weeks after the surgery. Beyond this, I mentioned during the initial consultation that my fiancé was having surgery overseas, and Dr. Hobbs asked how the surgery went for him both at my surgery and at the check in 3 weeks after. His concern (and the fact that he remembered) was very encouraging.

name: Allison Cash
text: I see Dr. Martin for thyroid issues and my son sees Dr. Kostrzewa for significant nasal/septum issues.  I have been pleased with the conservative treatment from both doctors, and I greatly appreciate that they explain everything thoroughly.  After being prescribed a nose spray that my insurance doesn't adequately cover, we came up with an alternative treatment that works just as well.   I also have been pleased with the office staff.  I was running late for an appointment because of being stuck at a light due to a traffic accident.  I called the office to let the know, and they were very understanding.  They are a very busy office, so I imagine they are fairly strict with their policies.  I haven't run into any problems though.  All in all, I would highly recommend this practice.

name: Katy Murphy
text: My daughter and I both see Dr. Kostrzewa and we are very pleased! He put tubes in my daughter's ears when she was 10 months and the procedure went well - she's now 3 years old and we've had zero issues since then. Also, he did sinus surgery on me due to chronic sinus infections. He did a great job of explaining everything about the procedure and recovery - I felt very comfortable with him and everyone else involved doing the surgery. I hate that other people have had bad experiences, but I have nothing but good things to say about this place!

name: Mary Parker
text: Incredible office staff, Dr. McFadden and his entire team are thorough, warm and knowledgeable! Highly recommend for children and adults.

name: B. R.
text: I liked Dr. John Kostrzewa, he was pleasant and took the time to answer my questions. The office staff seemed unorganized, as I had to tediously fill out the same paperwork I filled out online. Expect to wait at LEAST an hour past your appointment time, but don't be late or they can charge you a rescheduling fee.

name: laura brinkley
text: Performed T&A on my 4 year old daughter. Very pleased! Great doctor & staff!

text: Office staff non- caring...Office cold, drab, smells bad...Business ran..You're treated as if you are non- intelligent... Hidden costly and unnecessary procedures... NP fee same as physician fee, yet neither do a decent job...I've had an ear infection for 3 weeks, severe pain,nausea, cannot be seen until July 13th....Left messages 3 times...No return call from NP...If I hadn't let them talk me into having a tube placed in my ear, I would go elsewhere... The tube was to fall out in a few months... Has been in for 5 + years... Nothing but problems.. They want to remove it and place a new one....If I EVER get to see the doctor, I will have it removed, get a patch placed for the hole, and not go back after follow up...Do not recommend , period....

I think most of the negative reviews are things that occur with large places. The er sounds similar to me. People. Your milage may very.

Then he told us hatefully to find a new ENT. Even sent a certified letter to really seal in the fit he threw about it.

Do not recommend. I have a feeling he's making extra $$$ off all the procedures he just announces he's going to do without asking for consent or disclosing cost.

When I googled NA ENT a Madison location did not come up, you only see this if you scroll down or visit their website. Very unfortunate that I had to be penalized and inconvenienced for the mistake of an NA ENT employee.

name: Quincia “Quin” The Queen
text:
If I could give negative stars I would!  This is the most horrific ENT location EVER. How this place is still in practice is beyond the understanding of  God. I got a refferal for chronic hoarseness they never called me to confirmed my appointment. I recieved a bill for a no show appointment. I didn't even know they were my doctors. Frack, I didn't even know where this location was or  even stepped foot in there to sign paperwork. When I called to have it removed they refused saying this is just their  policy and I would only get a refund if the doctor said so. They confirmed an automated system called me but the call only lasted 2 SECONDS for "whatever reason". Did not a live person care to call?? Upon my question she said they don't place calls to patients for appointments. What in the world 🌍? Then they said they'll call me back.... guess what they didn't  call back, just like they didn't call me to inform me of a appointment. How surprising...😑

If you can drive even an hour to another doctor... DO IT!!!!!

Notice the ONLY 5 star rating was from a review from YEARS AGO with no comment. Most likely is fake.

name: Pfak C
text: Great Staff, called to check on me several times, I would continue to patronize with the physicians there.

text: Wow I got and appointment a month out. I️ get to the office and  still had to wait and hour to get to the back . You know you are in the wrong because you can’t look in the eye of the patient. So the question is to the floor I️ really hope the floor answer her back.

name: Christi Dutton
text:
I went to see Dr. Brocato a year ago. I was having vertigo attacks, ringing in my right ear along with pressure, and I explained I was having problems listening to people on the phone with my right ear. I took a hearing test at their office before the doctor saw me. Dr. Brocato walked in sat down and told me there was nothing wrong with my hearing and it must be allergies. He prescribed me the most expensive nasal spray on the market and sent me on my way. I suffered for a while and just tried to take different allergy medicines. I then started having more frequent vertigo attacks. A year later I decided something must be going on and asked to be referred to a different ENT.

I have now been diagnosed with Meniere's Disease. In the beginning of the disease there is a period of fluctuating hearing loss. If caught in time there is a chance to save the patients hearing. Thanks to Dr. Brocato overlooking my complaints and not scheduling a follow up visit for me, I now have permanent hearing loss in my right ear at the age of 29.

It was the worst medical experience I have ever had. He was very casual and treated me like a hypochondriac. We rely on doctors with "specialties" to be able to help us when things go wrong. Dr. Brocato completely overlooked my symptoms and brushed me off and now I am left dealing with the aftermath. It may not have been malpractice but it is bad practice.

name: Todd Jurhs
text: hmm, i'm not sure why the other folks here have had such a bad time with AL ENT.  I've always had great service and care from Dr. K. and i've been going to him for more than two years

text: We have used Jackson Surgery Center three times in the last two years and every visit was a positive experience. The billing department was very easy to work with. I was able to get someone on the phone every time I called to get an insurance issue resolved. I would highly recommend Jackson Surgery Center to anyone that needs the type service they offer. I would give them 10 stars if it were possible.

text: I had a great experience with my kind and caring nurses at my pre-surgery and recovery room time. I'd like to thank Cherri, Philanda and Cheryl personally for their great work. Doctor was very late so he didn't want to waste any time. Maybe it was for the best but it was definitely not my choice.

name: Russell Marks
text: I was schedule for a colonoscopy on Mar 4th.  I was notified that I had to report to Surgery Center for Covid 19 test prior to having the procedure.  I called the doctor's office to see if I could have it done in Prattville area as I lived North of Prattville and was told to call Jackson Surgery Center, I did and they said that would be fine.  So I got the test and a letter saying  I had a negative result.  Then next day I get a call from JSC saying what I had was not good enough.  I was asked why I didn't get tested at JSC and explained that it was more convient to have it locally.  She stated that she lived south of Montgomery and came to work every day.  This really upset me!  Long story short I had already spent a whole afternoon getting tested and by the time she called had already begun the prep and had to cancel the procedure.  They need to get better people friendly personal    to contact patients and get there act together as far as what is acceptable covid testing.  I had this procedure at the JSC (prior to Covid) and it was a great experience just glad I didn't have contact with this person back then.

resp.text:
Mr. Marks, thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We apologize for any confusion.  We will address this issue with our staff, the response you received certainly isn't our expectation. For future reference we have Important Covid Information on our website. You can find it here to review our policies.

https://www.jscal.com/blog/covid-19-information/
If you have further issues or questions please contact our director Missy Sallas 334-293-8484

text: Better check to see what you owe or they will not do the operation.  They never told me the countless times I’ve spoken with them.  They were extremely hateful.  I asked what I needed and they said insurance card and license.  I drove 4.5 hours and they were going to cancel on me!

resp.text: We thank you and are very happy to have had a positive impact on your experience.  Thank you for your kind words we will share this with our team.  With sincere appreciation. Take Care!

name: Jason York
text:
We were surprised by having to pay a second co-pay, one for the facility for the doctor. It was explained that this is because the doctor is not affiliated and it is an out patient surgery. However, the doctor's name is listed as part owner, not to mention the fact that we have had out patient surgeries in the past and not had separate co-pays. We will not be using this facility again, as it appears to be using any way possible to take money. We could have refused, but we already had the time scheduled off work, and it's hard to rearrange a surgery. At the very least, they could have let us know this in advance, instead of at the time of the surgery. We will be using the Baptist hospital system from now on.

Update: No, it wasn't really addressed, we were just told that we would have to pay again or reschedule. It's not about the money, it's about letting us know in advance that there are two separate co-pays, which was not done.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we apologize for any miscommunication. Our administrative team is aware of the concern and has addressed this with the patient.  If you need future assistance or have further questions about our billing policies, please contact our Administrator Mr. John Gray 334-293-8484

name: Barbara Sowell
text: Great experience! Wonderful staff. Highly recommend!

name: leo zemke
text: I am glad everyone else had such a fantastic experience at this place but they almost let my step son DIE!  He came in and was scheduled for exploratory surgery to fix SHODDY WORK DONE BY DR CHANDLER during a sinus polyp surgery and my step son began to pour blood from his Sphenopalatine Artery and the office was more worried about getting another three hundred dollar copay out of us than helping my son.  My wife had to scream for help in the office to get nurses and a doctor to get my son and help him.  We were treated shabbily during the whole ordeal.  My step son was bleeding to death and they did not even have the ability to  give him blood at this facility.  They almost killed him!  IT WAS HORRIBLE!  A HORRIBLE ORDEAL!!!!  I should post photos of all the blood.  The clinic manager was not friendly, everyone acted as if they did not know what was going on or what to do.  They had to take my son by ambulance over the the hospital and then the nightmare continued.  The ER doctor threw my son out of the hospital room that he was scheduled to be in.  It was like they tried to kill my son and then they were trying to sweep us under the carpet or out the door.  TO HIDE US AND THE HORRIBLE THINGS THEY DID AND THE WAY THEY ALMOST KILLED MY SON!!!   It was a nightmare!  They were going to give my son a blood transfusion in the ER and sweep us out the door.  MY WIFE HAD TO ENLIST THE HELP OF THE AMBULANCE DRIVERS Who could see that our son was in agony and practically DEAD AT THEIR HANDS!  The ambulance drivers GOD BLESS THEM talked the angry, crazy doctor into keeping our son and putting us in a room for the night.  This was the worst thing that has ever happened to our family.  I would not allow this clinic to operate on a PET COCKROACH if I had one!  PLEASE BEWARE!!!

resp.text: Dear Leo, we sincerely apologize for your experience with the Jackson Surgery Center.  We strive to provide the highest level of care equally to all of our patients.  We appreciate your feedback and are addressing the issues mentioned with our administrative team.  We promise to also forward your concerns to the Jackson Hospital Administration.  Our commitment to protecting patient privacy disallows us to discuss this in an open forum.  Please do not hesitate to contact our administrator John Gray at 334-293-8484

name: Whitney Boutwell
text: Very organized...very clean

I had some questions about anesthesia, and they actually brought the anesthesiologist to me to answer my concerns. After care and instructions were good.

resp.text: Carol we so appreciate your observations.   Thank you for noticing the “little” things we do to make your outpatient experience favorable.  Speedy recovery!  We will check on you soon!

text: I can't speak on the specialists due to the fact I felt that no one in this place deserved my copay and business, but let me say the front desk has some major issues. There's not enough floor space for 5 and nah I'm not going to sit on a dusty carpet floor inch to inch with folks hacking just to see a Dr. for sinus issues. Counterintuitive. Common sense would tell you that anyone good at their practice or caring and about their oath would not subject patients to a space that will literally worsen the conditions they're there with and willing to pay someone to help fix. If this is a purely for profit practice with no sense of compassion I understand business is business; my advice is to work on office space and hire some hard working smiling individuals. Customer service is the beginning and end to all business and if you can't understand that you will never multiply in profit or resources. Simple. Plenty of offices about 30 minutes South, East, and North of here that aren't a scene from an 80s episode of SNL. Have a blessed one!

resp.text: That’s great! Thank you for the review.

name: Zachariah Kesterson
text: I have suffered from sinus issues and infections for over 25 years. I have seen other specialists. Dr. Robertson is by far the best ENT I have ever been treated by. Dr. Robertson and his people are so kind and thorough. After a hearing test, an allergy test and catscan he discovered my sinuses were blocked with little to no openings in the passages. The surgery was scheduled quickly and the care was fantastic. The recovery was not bad at all. I have never felt better in my life. I can finally breathe through my nose with no obstruction, and I am not getting a sinus infection every month anymore. My family can even tell a difference in my mood. The surgery has been life changing. If you need ENT care, Dr. Robertson and his people are incredible.  Highly recommend.

resp.text: We are so glad you are feeling good! Thank you for coming to see us!

name: Charles Daryl Wideman
text: That want to charge you for appointment if you have to cancel, but they can't get you back to see the doctor at your appointment time. Always 20-30 behind. Also it seems they just want to upsell services.

resp.text: We are so sorry about this. We actually do not charge for canceling an appointment, just for a “no show”. We are working on improving our scheduling, so that the wait time is minimal.

name: Amy Wagar
text: Staff is very friendly. Dr Robertson takes time to explain everything to me. I had surgery to open sinuses and it is amazing the difference. I feel very confident in the care I've received there.

name: David Massengale
text: Dr Robertson did 2 surgeries on me, one to repair my deviated septum, the second on my sinuses. He did a great job! He is a very good ENT surgeon!!

name: Independent thinker
text:
Went in, thought I had bad allergy, was told by Dr Robertson I was allergic to  everything but mold and mildew. I had a bad feeling about it then. He suggested surgery to get air moving, idiot like I agreed. I could tell no difference after healing, didn't approach my original problem. I feel he wanted to pad his pocket at my expense.
I went to another Doctor, he didn't do the age old skin prick test, he drew blood and sent it off to be tested. Came back I was allergic to dogs only and just enough to register on the test it was so slight. Said I will probably have to have surgery to get it straight. Dr Robertson didn't do the job right.  He only did part of the job needed, why would he not do the whole job and not put someone through all that again?
GO AT YOUR OWN RISK!

name: Breunca Meadows
text: My experience started off good and went horribly wrong from there. Working in the health field I've learned that a patients health history pays a vital key in treatment. I show up to my 5:45 appointment for my surgery apparently no one from the nurses to the doctor reviewed my medical history which stated that I was anemic . After being prepped for my surgery I was then told that I wouldn't be having the surgery due to me being anemic. Which was stated that same day more than once to two different people. On top of wasting my time, including the week that I had already taken time off from work which was now a waste, I was told that I could  call back in two - three months once I was "cleared" to have the surgery! I wouldn't recommended to anyone who has any type of predisposed health issue.

resp.text: We are so sorry for the inconvenience.  We always put our patient's safety first.  Unfortunately, safety concerns can arise at any time.  Please give us a call if you have any additional questions.  Thank you!

name: Kevin Foote
text: Dr. Robertson changed my life! I visited him after hearing a radio commercial about balloon sinuplasty, and I was skeptical at first but after years and years of chronic sinus problems, I was desperate to try anything. Dr. Robertson was very warm & personable, and I could tell he really cares. Most doctors I've met are sort of callous, and it's hard to find one that'll talk to you like a real person. Kudos to Dr. Robertson for making me feel comfortable about this, because it's a lot to consider & a lot of money. I elected to go with the procedure, and I'm so glad that I did. I can breathe so much better now, I'm sleeping better, and I'm no longer constantly bothered by my sinuses throughout the day. I'm not breathing perfectly, of course, but I can definitely feel a significant improvement. I think as long as you're nor expecting rainbows & unicorns but can keep your expectations reasonable, you'll be satisfied. If I could go back in time, I would have the procedure again. Thank you Dr. Robertson!

name: JP
text: Dr. Robertson is a great doctor.  The best ENT in Birmingham. Dr. Robertson performed sinus surgery on me back in 1998. I was having severe miagrane headaches that would last for days.  After surgery I felt 100% better. I was amazed at the result. Also Dr. Robertson does NOT pack your sinuses after surgery. Today I'm still doing great and haven't had any other problems with my sinuses.

name: becky patterson
text: First time I got relief with my sinuses!

resp.text: We are glad you are feeling well!

name: Deana Mumpower
text:
I have had chronic sinus infections  for years.  My ears felt stopped up which was affecting my hearing.  Dr Robertson found the problem.  He suggested balloon  sinuplasty.  This has enabled my sinuses to drain properly and has alleviated  constant sinusitis. This procedure also opened my  ears.
The balloon sinuplasty  helped me so much, I took my mother (90) to see Dr Robertson.  She has had constant sinus problems for years.  Dr Robertson suggested the same procedure.  She is having great results, also.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
Dr. Robertson is absolutely amazing. I originally went in to see him about sinus issues that were making me miserable. He suggested that I undergo allergy testing. I did and my results revealed that I was allergic to 90% of what I was tested for, and I was severely allergic to most of those. I have started Rush Immunology and I look forward to feeling better in the future! Due to my anatomy (as found on CT Scan) Dr. Robertson recommended surgical intervention, and he performed a Septoplasty on me as well as addressed several other sinus-related issues during the procedure. Yes, post-op pn is never fun, but I am hoping to reap the benefits of the surgery in the near future.
I cannot thank Dr. Robertson enough as he has been so knowledgeable and helpful in explaining exactly what he feels is going on with my allergy and sinus issues. When I first met him, he came in and sat down and took plenty of time speaking with me...even after being in a long day of surgery. He is never rushed in my appts, and spends a good amount of time explaining things. His staff has also been so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable as well. I appreciate Dr. Robertson and his awesome staff more than they will ever know! Thank you ALL so very much!!!
(*FYI regarding another review below, the blood test used for allergy testing is NOT AT ALL considered to be the most effective at finding accurate results; research this)
